result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis L Hagen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis L Hagen

defendant.name: Hagen, Curtis L
defendant.address: P.O. Box 1016, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from defendant regarding warrant for non-payment, clerk responded

Called at 2:33 PM. Curtis Hagen appears in person and in custody with counsel Michael Rielly. State appears by Charles Simono. State - resolved - amend count #2 to misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a), plead g/nc to both counts, joint recommendation of 120 days in FC jail on each count, concurrent to each other, $300 fine on #1 and court costs only on count #2. Rielly and Hagen agree. Court amends count #2 to misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - reads new charge and penalty. Hagen pleads NC to count #2 as amended and #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Rielly makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - credit for 1 day. Hagen withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 120 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - credit for 1 day - no objections to the defendant serving this in another county but it is the ultimate decision of the sheriff(s), fine of $300 plus costs totalling $831.00 - paid in 60 days after release from incarceration/CO; count #2 - 120 days in FC jail - concurrent to count #1 - huber and good time allowed, costs - paid same as count #1, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on January 14, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Called at 10:08 AM. Curtis Hagen does not appear but his attorney Michael Rielly is in court. State appears by Charles Simono. State - defendant is in Vilas County Jail and has not yet sent discovery. Court continues bond, set for another FPT on 1/14/15 at 2:45 PM - writ needed.
Final pre-trial on December 10, 2014 at 10:45 am.

Called at 12:20 PM. Curtis Hagen does not appear but his attorney Michael Rielly does appear. State appears by JBC. Bednar - due to non-appearance of the defendent, moves for warrant. Rielly responds. Court issues bench warrant, body or $2000.00. Recalled at 12:22 PM. Curtis Hagen now appears with attorney Rielly. Hagen explains why he was late. Court quashes the warrant previously issued and reinstates signature bond. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for trial. State has filed Information that mirrors the complaint. Rielly has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court continues bond, accepts pleas, set for FPT on 12/10/14 at 10:45 AM.
Waiver of Prelim on October 23, 2014 at 11:45 am.
and Certificate of Appearance - Trooper SCD

Preliminary hearing on October 23, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Called at 9:10 AM. Curtis Hagen appears in person and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. State provides defendant with complaint in court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Hagen has contact SPD. Recess to talk to Burns. Recalled at 9:16 AM, now appears with Attorney Rielly. Rielly has complaint, waives further reading, waives time limits for PH. Court continues bond, sets for PH on 10/23/14 at 2:00 PM.
